channel.title: AWS Setup for Hosting Kong on Self-Paced
channel.description: Recent content in AWS Setup for Hosting Kong on Self-Paced

item.title: Provisioning EKS infrastructure
item.description: Creating an EKS Cluster Before getting started with the workshop, we recommend to have an EKS Cluster already available. If you don’t have one, please, follow these instructions. Creating an EKS Cluster We’re going to use eksctl to create our EKS Cluster. $ eksctl create cluster --name K4K8S --version 1.21 --region us-east-1 --without-nodegroup 2021-09-29 20:23:41 [ℹ] eksctl version 0.67.0 2021-09-29 20:23:41 [ℹ] using region us-east-1 2021-09-29 20:23:43 [ℹ] setting availability zones to [us-east-1f us-east-1c] 2021-09-29 20:23:43 [ℹ] subnets for us-east-1f - public:192.
